description: From out- +‎ laugh. Compare Saterland Frisian uutlachje, West Frisian útlaitsje, Dutch uitlachen (“to ridicule”), German Low German utlachen, German auslachen (“to laugh at”), Danish udle.

verbs.description: outlaugh (third-person singular simple present outlaughs, present participle outlaughing, simple past and past participle outlaughed)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To ridicule or laugh someone out of a purpose, principle, etc.; laugh down; discourage or put out of countenance by laughing.
examples: His apprehensions of being outlaughed will force him to continue in a restless obscurity. - Franklin

entries.meaning: (transitive) To laugh louder than, surpass in laughing.
